intro: Chaenorhinum brasianum, commonly known as the Brazilian yellowtop, is an annual flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides. It has slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are often clustered in racemes. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain regions.
